resources.name: Tae Kim's Guide to Learning Japanese
resources.description: Comprehensive free grammar guide covering beginner to advanced topics.
resources.descriptionLong: Tae Kim's Guide to Learning Japanese is one of the most popular free resources for learning Japanese grammar. It covers everything from basic sentence structure to advanced grammar patterns, with clear explanations and example sentences. The guide takes a unique approach by teaching grammar in context rather than through rote memorization.
resources.notes: Also available as an app. A must-read for all Japanese learners.

resources.name: Imabi
resources.description: Extensive Japanese grammar resource with detailed explanations.
resources.descriptionLong: Imabi is an incredibly detailed Japanese grammar resource that goes beyond what most textbooks cover. It includes lessons on classical Japanese, dialects, and nuanced grammar points. The site is particularly valuable for intermediate to advanced learners seeking deeper understanding.
resources.notes: Very detailed. Great for advanced grammar study.

resources.name: Wasabi Japanese
resources.description: Free online Japanese lessons with audio and exercises.
resources.descriptionLong: Wasabi Japanese offers free, structured Japanese lessons covering grammar, vocabulary, and reading. Each lesson includes audio recordings, example sentences, and practice exercises. The site is well-organized and suitable for self-study.

resources.name: Maggie Sensei
resources.description: Japanese lessons with natural, conversational examples.
resources.descriptionLong: Maggie Sensei provides Japanese lessons focusing on natural, conversational Japanese. The site covers grammar points, expressions, and vocabulary with plenty of example sentences showing real-world usage. Lessons are presented in a friendly, approachable style.
resources.notes: Great for learning natural Japanese expressions.

resources.name: JapanesePod101
resources.description: Audio and video lessons for all levels with extensive content library.
resources.descriptionLong: JapanesePod101 offers thousands of audio and video lessons for Japanese learners at all levels. The platform includes lesson notes, vocabulary lists, and interactive tools. While the free content is limited, the paid subscription provides access to a massive library of learning materials.
resources.notes: Huge content library. Can be overwhelming to navigate.

resources.name: NHK World Easy Japanese
resources.nameJa: NHKワールドやさしい日本語
resources.description: Free Japanese lessons from Japan's public broadcaster.
resources.descriptionLong: NHK World Easy Japanese provides free Japanese lessons from Japan's national broadcaster. The course includes audio lessons, video content, and downloadable materials. It's designed for beginners and covers practical Japanese for everyday situations.

resources.name: Marugoto Plus
resources.description: Free online companion to the Marugoto textbook series.
resources.descriptionLong: Marugoto Plus is the free online learning platform accompanying the Marugoto textbook series from the Japan Foundation. It offers interactive exercises, audio content, and cultural information. The platform follows the JF Standard for Japanese-Language Education.
resources.notes: Official Japan Foundation resource. Works with Marugoto textbooks.

resources.name: JLPT Sensei
resources.description: JLPT study resource with grammar, vocabulary, and practice tests.
resources.descriptionLong: JLPT Sensei is a comprehensive resource for JLPT preparation. It provides grammar explanations, vocabulary lists, and practice questions organized by JLPT level. The site is regularly updated and includes study tips and strategies.

resources.name: Japanese Test 4 You
resources.description: Free JLPT practice tests and study materials.
resources.descriptionLong: Japanese Test 4 You offers free JLPT practice tests, grammar explanations, and vocabulary lists for all levels. The site includes thousands of practice questions to help you prepare for the official exam.

resources.name: Bunpo.jp
resources.description: Japanese grammar dictionary with clear explanations.
resources.descriptionLong: Bunpo.jp is a Japanese grammar dictionary that provides clear, concise explanations of grammar points. Each entry includes example sentences, related grammar, and JLPT level information. Great for quick grammar lookups.

resources.name: Erin's Challenge
resources.description: Video-based Japanese learning with cultural content.
resources.descriptionLong: Erin's Challenge is a free video-based Japanese learning resource from the Japan Foundation. It follows a high school student named Erin and teaches Japanese through skits, manga, and cultural content. Great for visual learners.
resources.notes: Fun video content with cultural insights.

resources.name: italki
resources.description: Platform for finding Japanese tutors and language exchange partners.
resources.descriptionLong: italki is a language learning platform where you can find professional Japanese tutors and community tutors for one-on-one lessons. You can also find language exchange partners to practice with for free. Lessons are conducted via video chat.
resources.notes: Great for conversation practice with native speakers.

resources.name: Lang-8
resources.description: Writing correction platform where native speakers correct your Japanese.
resources.descriptionLong: Lang-8 is a language exchange platform focused on writing. You write journal entries in Japanese and native speakers correct them. In return, you can correct entries written in your native language. Great for improving writing skills.
resources.notes: Currently not accepting new registrations. Try HiNative instead.

resources.name: HiNative
resources.description: Q&A platform for language questions answered by native speakers.
resources.descriptionLong: HiNative is a Q&A platform where you can ask native speakers questions about Japanese. Get answers about grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural nuances. You can also help others learn your native language.
resources.priceDetails: Free tier available. Premium for additional features
resources.notes: Great for getting quick answers from native speakers.

resources.name: Tandem
resources.description: Language exchange app for finding conversation partners.
resources.descriptionLong: Tandem is a language exchange app that connects you with native Japanese speakers who want to learn your language. Practice through text, voice messages, and video calls. The app includes correction features and translation tools.
resources.notes: Good for finding language exchange partners.

resources.name: Tofugu
resources.description: Japanese learning blog with in-depth articles and resources.
resources.descriptionLong: Tofugu is a Japanese learning blog created by the team behind WaniKani. It features in-depth articles on grammar, vocabulary, culture, and learning strategies. The site also provides comprehensive resource guides and reviews.
